clinical_study.brief_title: Uses of Immunosuppression Therapy in Patients With Liver Transplantation
clinical_study.official_title: Trends of Immunosuppression Therapy and Their Effectiveness in Patients With Liver Transplantation

brief_summary.textblock: Conventionally, the outcome of liver transplantation is usually reported in terms of graft and patient survival, medical and surgical complications, but lack of health-related quality of life (HRQOL) that might be associated with immunosuppression complications (e.g., diabetes, hypertension, dyslipidemia, obesity, metabolic syndrome, cardiovascular disease, renal dysfunction, osteoporosis, and de novo malignancy), disease recurrence, and rejections after transplantation.

detailed_description.textblock:
Specific aims are proposed to achieve in this study:
1. To compare graft and patient survival rate, incidence of treatment-related adverse effects between different patterns of immunosuppression combination among patients received post-liver transplant care in Kaohsiung Chang Gung Memorial Hospital (KCGMH), Taiwan.
2. To quantify the long-term health impacts of immunosuppressive regimens on quality-adjusted life expectancy (QALE), the loss-of-QALE relating to immunosuppression therapy, and types of transplantation.

primary_outcome.measure: incidence of graft and patient mortality, treatment-related complications
primary_outcome.description: Patient will be followed from the date of liver transplantation to the occurence of outcome event for 5 years

secondary_outcome.description: health-related quality of life will be measured by EQ-5D-5L and 15D

other_outcome.description: QALE:quality-adjusted weight for each health status (measured by EQ-5D)will be multiplied by the survival time and then summed to calculate the number of QALE. Loss-of QALE: the life time expectancy (survival function) for thes study cohort will be compared with Taiwan general population of subjects who are age- and gender-matched with study subjects.

arm_group.description: adult liver transplantation recipients (>=20 years at the date of surgery)

biospec_descr.textblock: no biospecimens are to be retained

study_pop.textblock: Study subjects: Patients who had liver transplantation in Kaohsiung Chang Gung Memorial Hospital
